messages.content: What is the purpose of this repository?

The purpose of this repository is to provide a fix for the original ComfyUI-nodes-hnmr extension by hnmr293. It aims to maintain and provide updates for the community as the original maintainer hasn't been accepting pull requests lately.
Who created the original ComfyUI-nodes-hnmr extension?
The original ComfyUI-nodes-hnmr extension was created by hnmr293.

Latent nodes in ComfyUI-nodes-hnmr are a set of nodes responsible for handling operations on 4-channel latent tensors. These nodes are used for various operations like VAE encoding and decoding, random latent image generation, latent to image conversion, and more.
What is the input type and output type of the KSamplerOverrided node in ComfyUI-nodes-hnmr?
The KSamplerOverrided node in ComfyUI-nodes-hnmr accepts various input types and outputs latents.
Can I merge two models using ComfyUI-nodes-hnmr?
Yes, you can merge two models in ComfyUI-nodes-hnmr using the StateDictMergerBlockWeightedMulti node, which merges two models with per-block weights.
What is the role of the ImageBlend2 node in ComfyUI-nodes-hnmr?
The ImageBlend2 node in ComfyUI-nodes-hnmr is used for blending two images together with additional blend modes.
Who contributed to the development of ComfyUI-nodes-hnmr?
Contributions to ComfyUI-nodes-hnmr were made by hnmr293, spacepxl, and WeeBull.
